methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.advertise_mode
params.description: User-specified flag to indicate which mode to use for advertisement.

params.name: data.advertised_groups
params.description: User-specified list of prefix groups to advertise in custom mode, which can take one of the following options: - ALL_SUBNETS: Advertises all available subnets, including peer VPC subnets. - ALL_VPC_SUBNETS: Advertises the router's own VPC subnets. - ALL_PEER_VPC_SUBNETS: Advertises peer subnets of the router's VPC network. Note that this field can only be populated if advertise_mode is CUSTOM and overrides the list defined for the router (in the "bgp" message). These groups are advertised in addition to any specified prefixes. Leave this field blank to advertise no custom groups.

params.name: data.advertised_ip_ranges
params.description: User-specified list of individual IP ranges to advertise in custom mode. This field can only be populated if advertise_mode is CUSTOM and overrides the list defined for the router (in the "bgp" message). These IP ranges are advertised in addition to any specified groups. Leave this field blank to advertise no custom IP ranges.

params.name: data.advertised_route_priority
params.description: The priority of routes advertised to this BGP peer. Where there is more than one matching route of maximum length, the routes with the lowest priority value win.

params.name: data.interface_name
params.description: Name of the interface the BGP peer is associated with.

params.name: data.ip_address
params.description: IP address of the interface inside Google Cloud Platform. Only IPv4 is supported.

params.name: data.management_type
params.description: [Output Only] The resource that configures and manages this BGP peer. - MANAGED_BY_USER is the default value and can be managed by you or other users - MANAGED_BY_ATTACHMENT is a BGP peer that is configured and managed by Cloud Interconnect, specifically by an InterconnectAttachment of type PARTNER. Google automatically creates, updates, and deletes this type of BGP peer when the PARTNER InterconnectAttachment is created, updated, or deleted.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Name of this BGP peer. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.peer_asn
params.description: Peer BGP Autonomous System Number (ASN). Each BGP interface may use a different value.

params.name: data.peer_ip_address
params.description: IP address of the BGP interface outside Google Cloud Platform. Only IPv4 is supported.

methods.name: getAdvertisedGroups
methods.description:
User-specified list of prefix groups to advertise in custom mode, which can take one of the following options:

  • ALL_SUBNETS: Advertises all available subnets, including peer VPC subnets.

  • ALL_VPC_SUBNETS: Advertises the router's own VPC subnets.

  • ALL_PEER_VPC_SUBNETS: Advertises peer subnets of the router's VPC network. Note that this field can only be populated if advertise_mode is CUSTOM and overrides the list defined for the router (in the "bgp" message). These groups are advertised in addition to any specified prefixes. Leave this field blank to advertise no custom groups.

methods.name: getManagementType
methods.description:
[Output Only] The resource that configures and manages this BGP peer.

  • MANAGED_BY_USER is the default value and can be managed by you or other users
  • MANAGED_BY_ATTACHMENT is a BGP peer that is configured and managed by Cloud Interconnect, specifically by an InterconnectAttachment of type PARTNER. Google automatically creates, updates, and deletes this type of BGP peer when the PARTNER InterconnectAttachment is created, updated, or deleted.
